text: sadly not
it seems to be available internally only
Ok, and it would be wrong approach to use the same api request what is used internally just to brong this information?

Hello everyone!

Anybody knows if it is possible to send my custom PDF file instead of having the HubSpot template while creating a quote through API?

Or associating the PDF file I made from my tool to the quote created through API?

Thank you!

Hello folks, can I use externally <https://app.HubSpot.com/api/automationapps/v1/history?portalId=x> ? Because HubSpot API doesn't support entirely all the features like company workflows, internally in HubSpot is working like charm. Can I use this internal endpoint like with Nightwatch or Puppeter to get this data dynamically? (Dynamically means like I could do with API but is not supported currently.

You can do this but it's not advised as internal endpoints can change at any point. 

You'd also have to use cookie sessions with this method.

I know, but I was looking to ask to avoid being blocked for this reason, I know is a workaround but this is the only option I see for now until API HubSpot will support this feature. 

Do you think can be risky and I can be blocked for this? <@U03REFNRMB3>

Hi, I'm currently getting contact list membership by calling
```/crm/v3/lists/{ILS List ID}/memberships```
then searching the list for the contact's ID. Is there a property or search param way to call the contacts api and get the individual contact's memberships back or another more efficient way to retrieve this info for a single contact? Thank you much

I can't speak for HubSpot. Personally I wouldn't do it. 

Other do via Chrome Extensions.
With a marketplace App, I would focus 100% on Public APIs.

:wave: Hi all, I'm using the HubSpot API and this afternoon started getting 429 errors on every call to `crm/v3/objects/contacts/search` . My understanding from the docs is that it should allow 4 request per second as a rate limit, but currently I'm seeing all calls fail. Does anyone know if there are other undocumented limits that I should be aware of like a daily limit on the search API?

Here is a resource I found which may help...<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details#error-responses>

Maybe you have hit your "daily limit"?

Would be good to see the API logs or response with the details of the request.

View your logs here --> <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps#view-api-call-logs>

Is there an api to get the daily usage for each private app?

Because maybe this endpoint returns the combined usage of all the private apps.

*/account-info/v3/api-usage/daily/private-apps*
We started seeing them too. Nowhere near that limit recently
I’ve downloaded our logs. We’re getting *429* for every call to `companies/search` and we made a *total* *of 130 search calls all day.*
That seems the similar to what I'm seeing, but mine is for contacts/search. This is for a public OAuth app and not a heavy amount of calls.
Ours started happening at `2024-02-27T21:10:09.925Z`
do you have a timestamp for when you started getting 429s on all calls?
we just have a developer account so there’s no support contact available
The daily limit(s) can be found in the response headers
For each request you can check the response headers and handle your app accordingly.

Yes, I already saw that. But I need the daily remaining of each private app. I tried to call the api individually with each separate tokens, but daily remaining are quite the same. I think it still returns all the apps usage.

Ok - I understand what you are referring to.  I think the API has some issues.

I found this documentation --> <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/account-information-api>

For an account with multiple apps, I made the following request to : *`/account-info/v3/api-usage/daily`* 

```b'{"status":"error","message":"The scope needed for this API call isn\'t available for public use. If you have questions, contact support or post in our developer forum.","correlationId":"ba7ad0f6-d3bd-4a8f-b5d1-88b1385bea42","links":{"support":"<https://help.HubSpot.com/>","forum":"<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/bd-p/integrations>"},"category":"MISSING_SCOPES"}'```
Then I tried: *`/account-info/v3/api-usage/daily/private-apps`*

```b'{"results":[{"name":"private-apps-api-calls-daily","usageLimit":500000,"currentUsage":200,"collectedAt":"2024-02-28T04:27:01.512Z","fetchStatus":"SUCCESS","resetsAt":"2024-02-28T08:00:00Z"}]}'```

When I visit the private apps "overview" page and check the network tab - I see a request calling `<https://app.HubSpot.com/api/api-logging/v1/report/portal-usage>` which returns
```{
    "dailyLimit": 500000,
    "appUsage": {
        "1077771": 185,
        "1144546": 11,
        "1990357": 0
    },
    "collectedAt": 1709093622034,
    "resetsAt": 1709107200000,
    "dailyUsed": 196
}```
Notice how it has a breakdown of each private-app ID.

I'm not sure where things like inconsistencies should be sent - but it was interesting to explore.
Yes, but you can't make a request.

`b'{"status":"error","message":"The scope needed for this API call isn\'t available for public use. If you have questions, contact support or post in our developer forum.","correlationId":"ba7ad0f6-d3bd-4a8f-b5d1-88b1385bea42","links":{"support":"<https://help.HubSpot.com/>","forum":"<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/bd-p/integrations>"},"category":"MISSING_SCOPES"}'`
Do you have an idea of what's the problem of this error?

Yeah - my assumption is that the request is from the App which requires cookies and a bunch of other stuff.  This is a bit beyond my knowledge.  Important distinction is that this is not part of the API.
How about this endpoint? */account-info/v3/api-usage/daily*
It returns status error
Yup - problem with endpoint and needs to be logged but I'm not sure where.
I think they want you to share this here --> <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/bd-p/integrations>

Hi there! I’m using `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/line_items/${item.id}>` endpoint which returns details about items. It also returns properties including `name` property. But for one specific deal, the API doesn’t return `name` property. It feels like a bug but maybe I’m missing something. The support is not very helpful.

Any ideas who can I talk to or how can I resolve this?
